parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To lead astray, deceive, cause to wander. From plane; to roam.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

A lake. Probably from limen; a pond.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

Brimstone, sulfur. Probably neuter of theios; sulphur.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To examine, as by torture; I torment; I buffet, as of waves. From basanos; to torture.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
